title: Formula to Determine Mean
text: The formula for the mean of a hypergeometric distribution is $$\frac{nr}{r+b}$$ where n $$=$$ the size of the chosen sample, r $$=$$ the size of the group of interest (first group), and b $$=$$ the size of the second group.

title: Determining the Size of the Chosen Sample
text: What is the size of the sample? In other words, how many people will be selected to be on the committee?

title: Determining the Size of the Group of Interest
text: What is the size of the group of interest? In other words, how many not technically proficient volunteers are there in total?

title: Determining the Size of the Second Group
text: What is the size of the second group? In other words, how many technically proficient volunteers are there in total?

title: Use the Formula
text: Using the formula, what is the expected value rounded to the hundredths place?
